decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Narcomoeba, Bloodghast, and Prized Amalgam by utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion. By dredging with Life from the Loam and cards like Stinkweed Imp, the deck can recur creatures from the graveyard and enable powerful combos with cards like Conflagrate and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with an army of creatures while using cards like Creeping Chill to drain their life total.

The focus of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Arclight Phoenix while burning the opponent with spells like Lava Dart, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to utilize cheap spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard, and to maintain card advantage through Faithless Looting, Light Up the Stage, and Finale of Promise. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountain and Fiery Islet allows for consistent mana fixing and card draw, enabling a fast-paced and explosive playstyle.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt opponent's strategies with cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer while also having access to removal and disruption tools like Dismember and All Is Dust. The mana base is optimized for Eldrazi Temple and Urza's lands to accelerate the deck's game plan. Overall, this deck is focused on aggressive plays and capitalizing on the powerful Eldrazi creatures.

This Modern Aggro - Humans deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Mantis Rider and Thalia's Lieutenant. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play, while cards like Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, utilizing the tribal synergy of Humans to create an aggressive and proactive game plan. The manabase is optimized for casting creatures of various colors efficiently.

Utilize self-milling and graveyard recursion to quickly fill the graveyard with key cards like Creeping Chill, Prized Amalgam, and Bloodghast to overwhelm the opponent with a flood of creatures and burn spells. The deck is focused on quickly assembling key pieces in the graveyard to create a powerful board presence and deal massive damage in a short amount of time. By utilizing cards like Life from the Loam and Faithless Looting, the deck is able to consistently fill the graveyard and bring back powerful threats to win the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill it with powerful creatures and spells. By discarding cards to draw more and dredging cards from the graveyard, the deck can quickly set up explosive turns to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. Additionally, cards like Conflagrate can be used as a finisher to deal direct damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to efficiently dredge cards, generate value from the graveyard, and assemble a lethal board presence.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also using removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Fatal Push to control the board. It utilizes powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes graveyard hate like Nihil Spellbomb and creature recursion with Unearth. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggressive strategy, while also having disruption and flexibility to handle different matchups.

This Modern 1 vs 1 deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and trigger powerful effects from Thing in the Ice and Aria of Flame. The deck includes card draw and cantrips to help find key pieces, along with removal and disruption to control the board while overwhelming opponents with aggressive plays. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize its efficiency. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a fast-paced tempo to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing the opponent's life total by playing aggressive creatures and burning spells. It aims to maintain a fast tempo by efficiently removing threats using direct damage spells while deploying hasty creatures to apply constant pressure. The mana base is optimized for consistent red mana sources to enable casting spells with multiple red mana symbols. The deck's strategy is to capitalize on early game aggression and card efficiency to overwhelm opponents before they can stabilize or establish a strong board presence.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures with colorless mana to quickly apply pressure on opponents. With powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, combined with disruption spells like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while maintaining a strong board presence. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Ineffable provides additional utility and versatility in dealing with various threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures and disruptive spells to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill it with cards like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The synergy between discard outlets like Insolent Neonate and Faithless Looting, along with sacrifice outlets like Carrion Feeder, allows for explosive plays and enables the recurring of powerful creatures like Vengevine. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive onslaught of creatures, allowing for a quick victory through a combination of graveyard recursion and creature synergy.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a strong theme of Human tribal synergy. By utilizing powerful Human creatures like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Mantis Rider, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage provide disruption to control the board state, while Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment. The mana base is designed to support the diverse casting requirements of the Humans with Cavern of Souls and Ancient Ziggurat. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with a cohesive Tribal Aggro strategy.

This deck aims to consistently deal damage quickly to the opponent using cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Arclight Phoenix. It utilizes low costing spells and creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to quickly deploy threats and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Faithless Looting and Finale of Promise helps cycle through the deck and bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Lava Dart and Gut Shot to remove opposing threats and maintain board control.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures like Wild Nacatl, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear, supported by efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm. The deck also utilizes cards like Atarka's Command and Mutagenic Growth to pump up its creatures and push through damage. The inclusion of cards like Light Up the Stage and Dreadhorde Arcanist allows for card advantage and maintaining pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck focuses on quickly reducing the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize.

This deck utilizes artifacts to control the game, preventing opponents from attacking by using cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Torpor Orb. The deck also has ways to tutor for specific artifacts with cards like Whir of Invention and Karn, the Great Creator. The mana base is designed to support the artifact-heavy strategy, with lands like Academy Ruins and Botanical Sanctum. Overall, this deck's main focus is on utilizing Urza's ability to generate mana from artifacts and control the board to outlast opponents.

The deck aims to ramp up quickly with cards like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow to get to its win condition, which is casting Scapeshift to sacrifice lands and search for multiple copies of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, dealing a huge amount of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes Primeval Titan to search for Valakut and Mwonvuli Acid-Moss to disrupt opponent's land base. The deck includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Sweltering Suns to control the board and stay alive until it can assemble its combo.
